instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1707: What is A1707? A1707 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3072, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00281, 820-00928..
definitions.820-00281: What is 820-00281? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .
definitions.SMC_LID_RIGHT: What is SMC_LID_RIGHT? SMC_LID_RIGHT is a signal that tells the system if the lid is closed from the right LID sensor. If it is low, the system thinks the lid is closed – if it is 3.3v, the system thinks the machine is open. SMC_LID_RIGHT needs to be high for the machine to stay awake and have a backlight. .
definitions.SMC_LID_LEFT: What is SMC_LID_LEFT? SMC_LID_LEFT is a signal that tells the system if the lid is closed from the left LID sensor. If it is low, the system thinks the lid is closed – if it is 3.3v, the system thinks the machine is open. SMC_LID_LEFT needs to be high for the machine to stay awake and have a backlight. .
definitions.HALL_SENSOR_LEFT: What is HALL_SENSOR_LEFT? HALL_SENSOR_LEFT is a signal from the hall sensor on the left side of the machine that indicates that the lid has been closed. This is necessary for setting SMC_LID properly so the machine knows whether it is closed or open. When this is low, the machine will think it is closed which may cause it to go to sleep or have no backlight on the screen.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> won't wake from sleep with high fan spin
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMC_LID_LEFT_R</SIGNAL>=3.4v
<SIGNAL>HALL_SENSOR_LEFT</SIGNAL>=3.4v
<SIGNAL>SMC_LID_LEFT</SIGNAL>=3.4v
<SIGNAL>SMC_LID_RIGHT</SIGNAL>=0V
<SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL>=3.3V
I checked <SIGNAL>SMC_LID_RIGHT</SIGNAL> at <RESISTOR>R5253</RESISTOR>..
Then i jumped a wire from pin 1 of <RESISTOR>R5258</RESISTOR> to pin 2 of <RESISTOR>R5253</RESISTOR>.. 
now system is not coming up...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> won't wake from sleep with high fan spin
threads.message:
Why did that?
You've killed left lid signal too.
J5260 sensor is bad; remove <RESISTOR>R5253</RESISTOR> first...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> won't wake from sleep with high fan spin
threads.message:
I have remove <RESISTOR>R5253</RESISTOR>
Should i replace J5260 ?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> won't wake from sleep with high fan spin
threads.message:
Board should wotk now, with the jumper you did before.

If you change J5260, then solder back <RESISTOR>R5253</RESISTOR> and remove the jumper.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> won't wake from sleep with high fan spin
threads.message:
I have solder <RESISTOR>R5253</RESISTOR> and changed J5260...
System now boots fine and waking up from sleep..
But one of the fan spins high..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> won't wake from sleep with high fan spin
threads.message:
Compare diode mode readings around both fans circuitry.
Also test with known good fan...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> won't wake from sleep with high fan spin
threads.message:
Fan now spins normal after replacing it..
But system is not coming up with charger only..
It just displays charging sign and goes off..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> won't wake from sleep with high fan spin
threads.message:
Be sure to use 87W charger.
Also let 10-20 min to charge a bit the battery first...
